summary: This document is an email chain between a Program Manager at SigNet Technologies/Convergent Federal Solutions and a Communication Technician at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding a discrepancy in camera models ordered for installation. The technician notes the received cameras are not on the Bureau of Prisons' approved hardware list, and the manager recommends requesting an exception due to the rush to install and the obsolescence of most approved models.

events.title: Camera Procurement Discrepancy Reported
events.description: A communication technician at MCC New York reports receiving 135 Vicon cameras (Part Number V9420-W312MIR) instead of the proposed Won IC1M52WR-B9 model, which are not on the BOP's approved hardware list.

keyFacts: The email discusses a rush to install security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The Communication Technician received 135 Vicon cameras (V9420-W312MIR) that were not the proposed model and are not on the Bureau of Prisons' approved hardware list.
The Program Manager states that 90% of the cameras on the approved list are End-of-Life (EOL), complicating the procurement.
The recommended solution is to open a 'magic ticket' to request the received cameras be added to the approved list due to the installation rush.
The correspondence date is September 5, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, suggesting possible security upgrades.
